flavorText:
"When I was a child, we worried about picking the wrong mushrooms for the cook pot. Now we must worry about being picked ourselves."
—Halana, Kessig ranger

foreignData.flavorText: „Als Kinder hatten wir Angst davor, die falschen Pilze für unseren Kochtopf zu sammeln. Inzwischen habe ich Angst davor, dass die Pilze uns sammeln könnten." —Halana, Waldläuferin aus Kessig

foreignData.flavorText: "Cuando era pequeña, teníamos cuidado de no recoger los champiñones equivocados para la cazuela. Ahora debemos tener cuidado de que no nos recojan a nosotros." —Halana, guardabosque de Kessig

foreignData.flavorText: « Quand j'étais enfant, nous devions faire attention à ne pas ramasser les mauvais champignons. Aujourd'hui, nous devons faire attention à ne pas être nous-mêmes ramassés. » —Halana, ranger de Kessig

foreignData.flavorText: "Quando ero bambina, ci preoccupavamo di non mangiare i funghi sbagliati. Ora ci preoccupiamo di non essere mangiati." —Halana, ranger di Kessig

foreignData.flavorText: "Quando eu era criança, nossa preocupação era não pegar os cogumelos errados para pôr na panela. Agora nossa preocupação é não sermos pegos pelos cogumelos." — Halana, patrulheira de Kessig

name: Moldgraf Scavenger
originalText: Delirium — Moldgraf Scavenger gets +3/+0 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

rulings.text: The card types in Magic are artifact, creature, enchantment, instant, land, planeswalker, sorcery, and tribal (a card type that appears on some older cards). Supertypes (such as legendary and basic) and subtypes (such as Human and Equipment) are not counted.
The number of card types matters, not the number of cards. For example, Wicker Witch (an artifact creature) along with Catalog (an instant) and Chaplain’s Blessing (a sorcery) will enable delirium.
Because you consider only the characteristics of a double-faced card’s front face while it’s not on the battlefield, the types of its back face won’t be counted for delirium.

In some rare cases, you can have a token or a copy of a spell in your graveyard at the moment that an object’s delirium ability counts the card types among cards in your graveyard, before that token or copy ceases to exist. Because tokens and copies of spells are not cards, even if they are copies of cards, their types will never be counted.

text: Delirium — Moldgraf Scavenger gets +3/+0 as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
